item.title: Welcome to Quartz
item.description: This is a blank Quartz installation. See the documentation for how to get started.

item.title: DOER Process Documentation
item.description: This is the describing page for DOER Process. Thinking about Organize Possible task lists (not inbox!): SW Dev: 2approveâ€“2buildâ†2checkâ†2doâ†2growâ†2planâ†2sort PDCA but backwards: 2checkâ€“2doâ€“2plan (It is important to do check tasks first!) Garden analogy: seeds (grow), tree(project), roots (checks), leafs/fruits (acts) Inbox (2sort): Where everything arrives Incubator / Garden (2grow): Seeds / Cell / Egg: Abstract Idea Soon / Receptor: Wait for specific condition Planner Tool: Kanban-Board / Worklists (of actionable / checkable): ğŸŸ Check /Calls/ Pending 2check (need checking) â†’ Or in communication? ğŸŸ¡Do /Actions/Focus/Active 2do (do soon) ğŸŸ£Plan / Grow / Feed / Horizon / Init / Define / Next 2plan (stored) â†’ Or Incubator? (Done) â†’ Not shown ğŸŸ¢Export / Publish / Finish / Finalize â†’ Not a task category! (same as done) ğŸ”·Hold / Keep / Maybe / Res / Rest/ Know Calendar: For events.

item.title: Resolutionâ€“Precisionâ€“Accuracy
item.description: Since no measurement of a physical quantity is infinitely accurate, it is important to determine how much a measured value will most likely deviate from the unknown, true value of ...

item.title: OAuth
item.description: OAuth2 is a protocol to share access tokens between different parties. OAuth is not an authentication protocol because it says absolutely nothing about the user.

item.title: CRUD Operations
item.description: Stands for Create, Read, Update and Delete and are the four basic operations of persistent storage. CRUDHTTPSQLCreatePOSTINSERTReadGETSELECTUpdatePUTUPDATEDeleteDELETEDELETE.

item.title: Avoid Waste with R's
item.description: The hierarchy of waste management: reduce: Buy only what is needed. Buy less often. reuse: Buy high quality and reuse items before throwing them in the trash.

item.title: Classification Error Types
item.description: There are two error types in classification problems: False positives (FP) and false negatives (FN). I find it more convenient to think in False Alarms (FP) and Missed Hits (FN).

item.title: DOER Process
item.description: A method for processing documents and information based on GTD. DOER stands for DOER Overview Dump & Decide: Dump any input as short note into a central â€œinboxâ€.
